intro: Senghasia ocellata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters in the wild. Its flowers are usually violet or white, with a distinctive yellow or orange eye-like marking. Senghasia ocellata is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
